intro: Hermannia stellulata, commonly known as the starry hermannia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that resemble stars, hence its common name. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and are borne in dense inflorescences. Hermannia stellulata is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and stream banks.
